cluster_relations.rel_desc: Monitoring bird populations is an activity focused on observing and measuring bird populations.

qualifiers.OtherQualifier: MonitoringType: observation of numbers and trends

remarks: Relation created to link the conservation activity to the biotic component it observes.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Monitoring bird populations provides information about ecosystem condition.
remarks: State of ecosystems mapped to ecosystem condition construct.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Monitoring bird populations informs and guides conservation efforts.

qualifiers.ConditionExpression: when insights from monitoring are used in management

args.canonical_rel_desc: An activity that systematically observes and measures a target biotic or abiotic component.
args.justification: The subject is an explicit monitoring activity and the object is the population being observed; the core predicate is that the activity monitors that population.

args.canonical_rel_desc: A monitoring or observation activity generates information or insight about a system property or condition.
args.justification: The description emphasizes that monitoring bird populations yields information about ecosystem condition, so the predicate should capture the informational linkage from activity to system state.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Information from one activity or process is used to guide or support decisions or actions in another activity or process.
args.justification: The text states that monitoring bird populations informs and helps guide conservation efforts, so the predicate should represent that decision-guiding informational role.
This relation links a monitoring activity to the specific biotic component it observes and measures, i.e., the target of monitoring.

Both relations connect a monitoring activity to entities that are informed by or characterized via the monitoring (ecosystem condition; conservation efforts), forming a family of informational/indicator-type links from monitoring outcomes.
The relation represents an action (monitoring) directed at a patient (bird populations), fitting an agent–target interaction perspective.

Both relations describe how monitoring results provide information or guidance about other entities or activities, so their primary semantic dimension is informational rather than purely causal or compositional.
